title: How can one truly fork vscode-copilot-chat now that it is open source?

labels.name: *question
labels.description: Issue represents a question, should be posted to StackOverflow (VS Code)

body:
It's amazing that Microsoft open sourced the [github.copilot-chat](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat) extension for VS code.

Now as I forked it myself, I realized that `github.copilot-chat` has a dependency on the closed source `github.copilot` extension. It seems to me that this makes `github.copilot-chat` unforkable in practicality.

Am I missing something or is there future plan to make this possible?

title: Suggested repeatable check boxes in menus with multi-select functionality

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body: Description: In the current interface design, the options bar automatically closes every time an option is checked. If you want to check more than one option, you need to open the option bar repeatedly. I would like to be able to check multiple options at once without closing the option bar, i.e., the option bar does not disappear after selecting the checkbox.

title: Empty files created unexpectedly during Copilot development session

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Type: Bug ## Bug Description Multiple empty files (0 bytes) were created without explicit user request during an active GitHub Copilot development session. ## Environment - OS: Windows - Shell: PowerShell - Project: Chrome Extension + .NET API - Session: Intensive development with multiple tool calls ## Files Created Unexpectedly - AUTHENTICATION_TEST_GUIDE.md (empty) - COMPLETE_AUTHENTICATION_TEST.md (empty) - Various .ps1 test files (empty) - Several .cs test files in ServiceApi/ (empty) - HTML debug files (empty) ## Expected Behavior Files should only be created when explicitly requested ## Actual Behavior Empty files appeared in git status as untracked files ## Reproduction Occurred during session with: - Multiple file edits using Copilot tools - Terminal command execution - Git operations - File creation/editing tools ## Impact - Workspace pollution - Git repository clutter - Required manual cleanup ## Workaround Applied PowerShell command to find and remove empty files: `Get-ChildItem -Recurse -File | Where-Object { $_.Length -eq 0 } | Remove-Item -Force` Extension version: 1.350.0 VS Code version: Code 1.102.2 (c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0, 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

title: Add a copy icon at the bottom of the Copilot response section

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body: I suggest adding a copy icon at the bottom of the Copilot response section, so that users can directly copy the content of the Copilot response by clicking it. Please refer to the image below for details. Although it is currently possible to right-click in the Copilot response area to choose the copy option, I think this approach is not very intuitive and is inconvenient to use. Moreover, copying is a very frequent operation, and most AI products or editors provide a copy button directly at the bottom of the response area.

title: Serious issue with Copilot's recent behavior — ignoring facts and refusing to follow user instructions

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body: Type: Bug Recently, GitHub Copilot has been increasingly uncooperative and prone to confidently generating false information, even when users explicitly provide verified facts. A specific and frustrating example: I referred Copilot to the official AWS Glue documentation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/aws-glue-programming-etl-glue-arguments.html#job-parameter-reference Despite this, Copilot invented an “Availability” column and falsely claimed the --enable-metrics parameter is marked as “Spark jobs only.” That phrase does not exist on the page. There is no such column either. Even after pasting the full HTML source of the page, Copilot continued to ignore the actual content and repeated its hallucinated answer. This is not an isolated case. Copilot increasingly: Ignores URLs provided by the user Refuses to parse or consider pasted source code or HTML Generates confidently wrong answers even when verifiable evidence is present ❗ This behavior is unacceptable for a tool meant to assist with code and documentation-based tasks. If Copilot cannot acknowledge direct inputs from users or verify against official sources, it becomes a liability, not a help. I urge the team to prioritize: Making Copilot respect explicit user inputs (URLs, pasted HTML, code) Preventing hallucinations when facts are available Adding mechanisms to let users force Copilot to consider the given content Thank you, but this must be addressed seriously. Otherwise, confidence in the tool will continue to erode. title: Testing: Show chat terminal command results

title: Multiple PR cards shown when only one PR is open.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

body: Testing #258212 1. Make some edits to a source file 2. Ask `#copilotCodingAgent` to create a PR with the changes 3. Close the PR (do not merge) 4. Make some more edits 5. Ask `#copilotCodingAgent` to create a new PR with the changes Result: Multiple PR cards are shown, and it's hard to discern which one is the open vs closed PR. I think it's preferable to have some visual indication whether the PR is open or closed or add logic so that only the PR created or active in the chat view is shown.

title: clicking on PR widget does nothing
body: Testing #258320 when I got this widget in the chat UI the way the text fades makes me think if I click on the widget it would open it more or allow me to expand the PR. I know I can do it via clicking the `#2` but I would want that to open when click anywhere or make the widget not feel as "unfinished" and like it should be expandable

title: Well, here I am again. tiriiiing as F!!
body:
Type: Bug Again, I am looking like a spam right now, but it isn't! this is how offten I get this stupid error!! EVERY TIME, again, EVERY SINGLE TIME... I use GitHub Copilot, doesn't matter the model, after a while it gets stuck, either with the error that I am reporting (413), 412 or "Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: 89f70909-b7db-40b9-94f6-3f92e50e6e32 Reason: Please check your firewall rules and network connection then try again. Error Code: net::ERR_HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR.". And not only that, it gets my entire computer to lag, freeze and slowing it down until I close the VS code entierly and start a new session/re open it. This is VERY annoying, not only because it makes me waste my time closing and openning it again but also because I have to restart my session whitout a chance to store/take note of what was done, which means all the contex is gone and a lot of wasted time to get the AI aware of context and back on track. As a paying customer, pricipally to microsoft, this is the worse experience ever with an AI "copilot". body: Type: Feature Request Thank you very much for putting this Feature request form In easy to get place because I totally support Microsoft and I wanna see you guys do as good as possible not that you aren't already but basically there there's a plug in that you can get for Visual Studio Code called Paste by Select and basically It will select the code automatically for you after you paste it as when you're pasting code you always gotta indent it don't you?.. So this feature request is a feature request that you add a feature like that right under The paste button in Visual Studio Code so people could automatically paste code and have it selected. I sent a feature request to the maker of The paste by select plugin that they should put A button to invoke their Paste by select feature on the Visual Studio Code right click menu and also put a flyout menu that would allow you to paste selected and auto indent one tab or two tabs or three tabs you know three extra items in a flyout menu right under that and if you add that to visual studio code that would totally optimize the performance for basically all your users... Thanks for the latest update to Windows 11 it's absolutely beautiful... One more note as far as efficiency See you have a button that says preview on Github but then when I click that because it's the only option I gotta sign into Github and I'm really busy you see and that's a little bit of a hindrance because then I gotta go get up and get my phone and find my authenticator app on the phone and get the number and type it in I would just have a button where you could well I would have two buttons you could either preview it on Github or send it I guess to get hub directly with no other steps involved... I'm a genius at logic ... And the easier that you make this you know the more often I could send cool upgrade ideas because I do fully support microsoft... And just to note not everybody has it easily set up to sign in to do feature requests on Windows 11 and before you didn't make it so you had to sign in and it was easy to send feature requests but now that you have to sign in see I have a lot of feature requests for you for Windows eleven that are on the backlog that I can't send because i'm building a corporation and uh I don't really have extra time to waste so if you could put that back to feature request just always working w/o login that would be way more awesome I can send you cool ideas all the time.
